instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Mac Pro 2013 - A1481 - Anyone has experience with these machines?
threads.message:
Hi,

I have that MacPro which just light the I/O board for a few seconds and then turns off.
I can't even say it tries to turn on.

After disassembling the unit, I've found some corrosion on the interconnection board.
I have reworked that board as thorougly as I could but no improvements.

I am getting some 11V 3,4V measurements on the interconnection board so I assume the power supply is fine and the board itself is having power.
I have heard that these machines could have GPU defects which would leads to a brick MacPro but since there was some corrosion on the interconnection board...

Anyone has experience how to troubleshoot such unit?
